title: San Jose: Three arrested in teen’s killing near Dove Hill Park
content:
SAN JOSE — Three San Jose residents were arrested in the past week in connection with the October shooting death of a 17-year-old boy during a robbery attempt near Dove Hill Park, police said.
The shooting was reported the night of Oct. 19 near Ravens Place Way and Muir Place near Yerba Buena Road and Highway 101, when police say 17-year-old Umberto Salas was sitting in a parked car with a man and at least two suspects approached them.
The suspects reportedly tried to rob the occupants of the car, during which Salas was shot and the man was assaulted. Salas was rushed to the hospital by friends or family, where he died from his injuries.
An ensuing investigation led to the Dec. 22 arrests of Marcos Antonio Jimenez, 20, and Suzette Angel Campos, 19, in San Jose. On Wednesday, police arrested Marco Antonio Ruiz, 19, also in connection with the shooting.
All three were booked into the Santa Clara County jail on suspicion of murder. Additional details, including a motive, were not released.
Anyone with information about the shooting can contact SJPD homicide Detective Sgt. Raul Martinez or Detective Brian Meeker at 408-277-5283 or leave a tip with Silicon Valley Crime Stoppers at 408-947-STOP or svcrimestoppers.org.
